title: Types of Commercial taxes in India (Akhil Pandey)
text: By Akhil Pandey Jul 25, 2015 The commercial taxes in India are of various types which can be checked at commercialtaxesindia.com including CST (central sales tax), VAT etc plays an important role in state's fiscal needs and foundation. The management and administration of the commercial tax process is quite lengthy and hefty as it involves handling of number of people at a time, collection of taxes from consumers and then depositing it to the state so as to add into state's treasure. As the whole process was difficulty so to make the process easy along with ensuring quick service and transparency, Commercial Tax MMP was brought forward. This process includes the following:1. E registration i.e. online registration2. E return i.e. filing the return electronically or online3. E refund i.e. clearing all the refunds online4. E payment i.e. doing payment of taxes online5. Availability of online CST statutory form issuance from tax information exchange system that also helps in sharing data with other states.6. Obtaining any information regarding the services is also available online7. Dealing with ledger online.The introduction of Commercial MMP is a boon as it facilitates dealers with online registration under acts, self creation of id in order to access the e services. The types of commercial taxes in India include the following:The taxes which include the activities of commerce are referred to as commercial tax. Activities of commerce include sale, purchase and exchange of the products and services.1. Sales based commercial taxThis is a type of tax emerging from the gross value added to the final sale of the products and services. On the other hand the sales tax is also known as indirect tax as the consumer does not directly pay to the government but to the merchants.2. VATThis is the value added tax. It relies on the net value of the product or service i.e. when all the cost like production, marketing, distributing, promoting, packaging and all are included in it that results in onetime payment for that product or service to the governing body. This tax is of commercial type as it also includes the commerce activities of selling, purchasing and so on.3. Tax based on consumptionSuch consumption based commercial tax is the one based on the number of purchases taking place in the economy with regard to individual service or product.4. Business based taxThe taxes which are levied when business or commercial operations take place, applicable to sorts, types and nature of business. In case of international business, when taxes are levied on the import and export of products and services, then they are also known as business and commercial taxes.5. Excise based taxThe taxes when are applicable on specific type of products where the tax amount is shared by the manufacture with his or her customers. For example in the items like fuel, cigarette, alcohol and so on are considered under this category. Such taxes are also known as indirect tax as the consumers do not pay taxes directly to the government but pay taxes during their purchase.The introduction of Commercial MMP is a boon as it facilitates dealers with online registration under acts, self creation of id in order to access the e services. About the Author The author Akhil Pandey has deep interest in what contributes to the fiscal process of our economy and that is the reason the author searched about the types of taxes especially the commercial taxes in India which contribute about 60 to 70 percent of the total revenue of the country (including states and union territory).
